definition: after the calamity, renewed life (idiom); new lease of life
to rob/to plunder/to seize by force/to coerce/calamity/abbr. for kalpa 劫波[jie2 bo1]
back/behind/rear/afterwards/after/later/post-
extra/surplus/remaining/remainder after division/(following numerical value) or more/in excess of (some number)/residue (math.)/after/I/me
surname Yu
variant of 餘|余[yu2], remainder
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: The people who have survived the disaster usually have a better understanding of life.
sentences.chinese: 劫後餘生的人們通常對生命的理解更深刻。

sentences.english: Those who have survived realize the meaning of life .
sentences.chinese: 那些劫後餘生大難不死的人，認識到了生命的意義。

sentences.english: He has come through two world wars.
sentences.chinese: 他身經兩次世界大戰，劫後餘生。

sentences.english: Koch began giving spectacularly large donations to the arts and sciences.
sentences.chinese: 劫後餘生的科赫開始在藝術和科學領域大額捐款。

definition: lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
to be drowned (figurative and literal)
all black, no daylight (idiom); a world without justice
no way out/nowhere to go/trapped beyond hope of rescue/painted into a corner
fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
to tolerate is to nurture an evildoer (idiom); spare the rod and spoil the child
fire of war everywhere (idiom); enveloped in the flames of war
lit. to fall behind Sun Shan 孫山|孙山[Sun1 Shan1] (who came last in the imperial examination) (idiom)/fig. to fail an exam/to fall behind (in a competition)
to prevail upon/to coax
seize every minute and second (idiom); not a minute to lose/every moment counts
(idiom) to talk in a roundabout way to cover up the truth/evasive
protracted (idiom)/long and drawn-out
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
trench/moat
boundary line/border line
